briefdescription.para: Reset the writer with a new stream.

detaileddescription.para: This function reset the writer with a new stream and default settings, in order to make a Writer object reusable for output multiple JSONs.

memberdef.name: IsComplete

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the output is a complete JSON.

detaileddescription.para: A complete JSON has a complete root object or array.

memberdef.name: GetMaxDecimalPlaces

memberdef.definition: void Writer< OutputStream, SourceEncoding, TargetEncoding, StackAllocator, writeFlags >::SetMaxDecimalPlaces
memberdef.name: SetMaxDecimalPlaces

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum number of decimal places for double output.

detaileddescription.para: This setting truncates the output with specified number of decimal places.
The default setting does not truncate any decimal places. You can restore to this setting by calling writer.SetMaxDecimalPlaces(Writer::kDefaultMaxDecimalPlaces);

detaileddescription.para: Writer implements the concept Handler. It generates JSON text by events to an output os.
User may programmatically calls the functions of a writer to generate JSON text.
On the other side, a writer can also be passed to objects that generates events,

parameterdescription.para: Type of allocator for allocating memory of stack.
